intro: Chaenactis brachiata var. stansburyana, commonly known as the Stansbury's rayhead, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are yellow to orange in color, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by wind. This variety is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
